item.title: Former Atari board member appointed chief operating officer
item.content:encoded:
Diego Argüello, Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

November 4, 2025

1 Min Read

Image via Kelly Bianucci (LinkedIn) and Atari

Newsbrief: Kelly Bianucci, who served as director and chair of the audit committee at Atari for over five years, has been appointed chief operating officer at the company.

Announced via press release, this new position will report to Atari chairman and CEO Wade Rosen. In a statement, Rosen said Bianucci will help the company shape its strategy and implement operating structures and best practices across the organization, which will be "incredibly important as we continue to transform and grow."

The chief operating officer's previous experience includes stints in the international marketing and communications team at MTV Networks, channel marketing at Take-Two Interactive, and a role as senior consultant in strategy and operations at Deloitte Consulting, among others.

"After years of wild highs followed by long quiet years, Wade Rosen took the helm and rebuilt the company around gaming, heritage IP, and growth," Bianucci wrote on LinkedIn. Today Atari is a growing force in the largest sector of entertainment. For nearly six years I’ve been part of that journey from the board side. Now I get to go all-in."

About the Author

Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Diego Nicolás Argüello is a freelance journalist and critic from Argentina. Video games helped him to learn English, so now he covers them for places like The New York Times, NPR, Rolling Stone, and more. He also runs Into the Spine, a site dedicated to fostering and supporting new writers, and co-hosted Turnabout Breakdown, a podcast about the Ace Attorney series. He’s most likely playing a rhythm game as you read this.
